title: Simple and secure
comment: Super simple: just need to open the app, exactly like using Google Authenticator, then tap the YubiKey to the NFC reader. The one-time codes then appear. Couldn't be easier.

title: Keep it up!
comment: The recent update fixed all of the issues I was having on my S6. The YubiKey Neo is well worth the investment for the peace of mind it gives me. Everything works flawlessly. Just tap the Neo, and all of your OTP codes appear just like they would in Google Authenticator. The only thing I ask is for an update of the desktop version!

title: I love this app.
comment: I know from experience that my phone will be broken, lost, stolen, or replaced, while my keys remain safe and sound where I always keep them. This app (in conjunction with my Yubikey Neo) makes 2FA more safe and practical. Thank you Yubico! Five stars overall, although other reviews make good requests such as the ability to edit, and the ability to backup to a secondary Yubikey Neo.

title: Automatic start on tap
comment: The automatic start app on yubikey tap doesn't work for my device (nexus 5) please fix for 5 stars

title: NFC bug fixed.
comment: Google Authenticator without having the secrets on the phone.

title: Convenient
comment: Convenient and secure way of storing and using your credentials.

title: Support for backup key would be useful
comment: Support for a second Yubikey would be very useful (copy credentials to a backup key). However a very good and useful app!
Very happy with the recent updates!

title: Non functionality
comment: App doesn't work on my oneplusone. Update - didn't have barcode scanner installed

title: Not working on galaxy s6 with android beam
comment: This needs to be addressed asap as I will be unable to authenticate using many services without it. Edit: I had to turn off android beam in order to get it working correctly. Very strange

title: Amazing tool, must have for all Yubikey Neo
comment: I bought the Yubikey Neo so I could use it for lastpass OTPs on my phone. I had no idea I could store these things on my Yubikey and use verification codes on tons of sites. This is great, I must tell others about this.

title: not working on Galaxy S6
comment: App is not working on galaxy s6 huge issue since I use it daily.

title: Does not work with a non-camera phone
comment: It works on a camera phone, but does not work on a non-camera phone. Should incorporate feature to manually key in code.

title: Great, but needs options to manually enter and edit
comment: Excellent app, works great with my NEO and breaks the tie between me and only using one device for an authenticator. I can bring it to a tablet or even a foreign device for a one-time password and not have to trust the device because the key stays on the YubiKey. It lacks the ability to manually enter a secret key and also lacks the ability to edit/rename previous keys. The timer that times out isn't a representation of when the 2FA code expires, it seems to be an internal timeout that has nothing to do with that unfortunately.

title: Encodes non-ASCII passwords incorrectly
comment: Works nicely.
This has been fixed in the latest version.

title: Works!
comment: Still want to be able to add accounts by typing in the secret...
The issue has been identified, and a new build will be pushed shortly. Sorry for the inconvenience!
An update broke functionality for a day but it was quickly fixed.
The issue has been identified, and a new build will be pushed shortly. Sorry for the inconvenience!

title: Ok
comment: Nice app that could use some improvements: ability to set account with secret OR qrcode, not having to tap yubikey twice (one for pin and a second one for getting the codes) , ability to edit account names; to name a few that come to mind.

title: Decent
comment: The application works as expected. Storing my privates on the Yubikey instead of my phone, which makes it easy in case my phone gets lost or stolen. However there are many improvemnts that could be made to this app.   1. A better UI, a reorderable list, service icons to easier identification 2. Allow me to choose which service I generate a token for, instead of ALL

title: Multi device authenticator OTP!
comment: I factory reset, flash, or otherwise change my device so often that the burden of setting up authenticator for the 30th time made me stop using my 2fac services. YubikeyNeo and this app to the rescue. With the app, the hardware really shines. Its all about the applets.

title: Needs option to add accounts using secrets
comment: Works great with my Neo. Would like support for adding accounts using secrets instead of QR only.

title: Great
comment: But, possibility to reorder entries would be nice. Also, flexibility in what QR reader is used, would be appreciated.
It's good for you™

title: Perfect
comment: Works flawlessly.  Must have for any YubiKey user!

title: Easy to setup with one key
comment: Had no problems setting up the NEO with my app. My main concern is if I ever lose the NEO. Can you use multiple NEOs with the app in case one NEO is lost (i.e. is it possible to associate multiple NEO with YubiOATH and NFC?)﻿ Support is too technical for non-techies or not always clear.

title: Works Now!
comment: Now that the applet is pre-installed on new Yubikey NEO's it's super easy to use.

title: This is the same as Google Auth
comment: They both work the same way. Google Authentication supports the use of a YubiKey for 2 Factor

title: Safer than Google Authenticator
comment: Using Google Authenticator on my rooted phone always felt a bit risky. Storing the secrets on my Yubikey is a great solution.

title: So far so good.
comment: I like the added security of not storing the secret key on my ROOTED phone.  The app only offers scanning of QR-code for adding a new account. It also needs method to manually enter a provided key when no QR-code is available.

title: Nice
comment: Just as description says. Nothing special.

title: Now super easy setup
comment: Currently there is a tool that makes Yubikey setup a breeze. I like the concept and the tools.

title: Nothing happens
comment: After much heartache, pain and suffering, I finally had to wipe out the config on my Neo, it must have been corrupted. I then went thru the 2fa setup again. Rebooted my phone, big mistake. So many android services try to authenticate it overwhelms the device. You can't get thru the process in time. You have 2 log in via Android 1st, then get directed to a browser then other authentication prompts pop up causing the browser to timeout. Crazy madness

title: Good but there are better alternatives
comment: Although you can use more than one device,  but there's no way to backup, what if lost the data.   Maybe secure but what if someone steal ur neokey.   I find Authenticator Plus better than this.

To make backups, save a copy of the QR code when adding a credential.
For security against theft, set a password to protect your NEO from unauthorized access (select "Change device password" from the actions menu).

title: Works Great!
comment: I'm much happier not storing the private keys on my phone.   The NEO was much easier to set up than the description made it look.... So far it works flawlessly!

title: Very Secure
comment: I love the idea of one time passwords, but storing them locally is a bad idea i love the Yubikey neo

title: Amazingly Secure!
comment: Just as convenient as Google authenticator, but secrets are stored on the yubikey!  Yes, Google authenticator does store your secrets on the phone. I have backed up, restored and viewed the database on my rooted phone. So a hacker can just as easily steal your oath secret database and install it on another phone. Scarry huh? Luckily with this app once set up properly your cryptographic secrets are stored on your yubikey! You need to "flash" your yubikey with the yubioath "applet" otherwise this won't work.

title: Great app!
comment: Granted app install on key isn't the simplest. You keep both slot functionality and can store codes on the yubikey neo, awesome!

title: Communication error
comment: I have a brand new neo and this app keeps saying 'error in yubikey communication'. Other neo compatible apps work fine.

I've updated the description with a link to a guide in our forum that describes how to install the applet onto the YubiKey NEO. We do not yet ship NEO's with this applet pre-loaded, so you will have to manually install the applet for it to work.

title: Perfect solution
comment: I can't imagine a better way to handle all these OAUTH secrets!

title: Ease of use and high security
comment: The YubiKey NEO combined with this app achieves the best of two worlds!
